SENT.plain: The authors describe the favourable outcome of general anaesthesias in a female patient with achondroplastic dwarfism and in another patient with dystrophic dwarfism
In the first patient the gall-bladder was removed and a plastic reconstruction of the diaphragm was carried out
In the second patient a Girdlestone's operation was performed
The difficulty of intubation of the dystrophic dwarf due to stiffness of the cervical spine suggested a procedure of intubation under fibroscopy

The doses of agents and the size of the tracheal tubes were calculated on the basis of the patients weight and the controlled ventilation was carried out after determining the current volume and the respiratory frequency in the awaken patient
